intro: Daviesia corymbosa var. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright habit and pinnate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open forests and rocky areas. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
